title: MBA Admissions | Admissions Information | Vanderbilt Business School

Insider's Guide to Admissions
LOADING
We encourage you to apply as early as possible.

Application Deadline
Decision  Release Date

Rolling Admission
Rolling Admission
*To ensure adequate time for visa processing, Round 4 is the final deadline for international applicants.
When determining when to apply, consider the following:
We anticipate your application will be complete on the application deadline date. Applicants who are missing checklist items one week after the deadline date will be moved to the next round.
Apply by Round 4 for priority consideration for other merit-based scholarships.
Pathway2MBA and VU2MBA candidates may apply in Rounds 4 & 5.
All decisions for each round will be published on the decision release date and we are unable to provide early decisions.
A complete Vanderbilt MBA application includes:
A submitted
online application
Academic transcripts
Evaluative interview
Letter of recommendation
Official English Language Exam or approved waiver (for International Candidates)
Official standardized test score or approved test waiver
Resume
Video response
Written statements
For additional information on any of these pieces of the Vanderbilt application, please
contact us
.
LEARN HOW TO APPLY
online application
Standardized Test or Approved Test Waiver
unofficial transcripts
letter of recommendation
resume and work experience
video response
short written statements
evaluative interview
information for international applicants
additional information
We recognize that business school is a significant investment in your personal and professional development and are committed to helping students afford the cost of tuition by offering scholarships and low-interest loan options.
However you choose to finance your MBA, know that the post-MBA jobs and salaries secured by our students often make the loan payback period significantly shorter than anticipated. For more information on post-MBA salaries,
view our exceptional outcomes
.
TUITION & Expenses
LOANS & OTHER RESOURCES
SCHOLARSHIPS
Vanderbilt MBA admissions events are designed to help you learn more about our program and get to know our community. We offer opportunities to connect on-campus, off-campus, and virtually.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)
INCOMING EXCHANGE STUDENTS
Vanderbilt offers graduating seniors a clear pathway to obtain their MBA through our deferred admissions programs. Graduating seniors who are U.S. citizens can apply to the MBA program at the end of their senior year, and if accepted, start after gaining work experience. Learn more about our deferred admissions programs
here.
Deferred Admissions Programs
Deferred Admissions For Undergrads Outside of Vanderbilt

We encourage you to reach out to our Vanderbilt MBA Recruiting and Admissions Fellows to hear about their experience, and learn more about our program and student life.
Connect with a Student
Admissions Criteria
Q.
Can I apply if I already completed an MBA or similar degree from another school?
A.
Vanderbilt does not admit applicants seeking a second MBA degree or similar graduate management degree, regardless of where the first was obtained. Exempt from this policy are master's degrees that focus on a specific functional area of business (such as accounting, finance, or management information systems) and do not offer a broad general management curriculum typical of the MBA degree.
Q.
Does the Vanderbilt MBA program require any quantitative courses as prerequisites?
A.
There are no specific prerequisites for our program. Before classes start, Vanderbilt offers a Quant Camp review program for incoming MBA students. Candidates with little or no business background are urged to review statistics, basic finance, accounting, and/or economic principles before the program in order to be adequately prepared for the quantitative rigor of the program.
Click here
for a detailed explanation of our admissions criteria.
Q.
Does the Vanderbilt MBA program accept transfer students or transfer credits?
A.
No. We are unable to accept transfer students or transfer credits. If we do admit an individual who is already enrolled in another full-time MBA program, transfer credits will not be accepted and the student will be expected to complete all 62 credits required for the Vanderbilt MBA degree.
Q.
Does the Vanderbilt MBA program accept a 3-year undergraduate degree?
A.
Applicants must have obtained a four-year U.S. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college, or its equivalent, and you can view our
international education requirements here
. We strongly recommend candidates with a 3-year degree obtain and submit a WES or IEE course-by-course evaluation showing degree equivalency. In some cases, a course-by-course evaluation showing degree equivalency will be required for application evaluation.
Q.
What kind of work experience does the Admissions Committee consider?
A.
We consider all full-time work, including military experience and volunteer work. Most students in our program have at least 2 years of work experience, with the majority of students having an average of 4-6 years of full-time post-baccalaureate experience.
Events & Visits
Q.
Can I conduct an on campus visit?
A.
Campus Visits are offered on select Mondays and Thursdays while classes are in session. To schedule your visit,
click here
.
SEE ALL MBA FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Take the
Next Step

apply?
Get Started Today

Get Started Today Vanderbilt gives you the flexibility to shape your curriculum to meet your needs and career goals. Our Mod System gives you a leg up by exposing you to core and elective courses before interviewing for summer internships. You can further customize your curriculum by adding concentrations, specializations, and emphases, or by taking advantage of our many immersion learning opportunities and independent study courses. The Vanderbilt MBA is STEM-designated , allowing international students to extend their training in the U.S. by 24 months. VIEW THE CATALOG YEAR ONE Mod 1 (Fall) Expand Course Credit Hours *Introduction to Financial Accounting 2 *Managerial Finance 2 *Leading Teams and Organizations 2 *Management Communication 1 *Managerial Statistics 2 *Required Course Mod 2 (Fall) Expand Course Credit Hours *Managerial Economics 2 *Marketing Management 2 *Operations Management 2 *Required Course Mod 3 (Spring) Expand Course Credit Hours *Strategic Management 2 *Introduction to Managerial Accounting 2 Elective 2 Elective 2 *Required Course Mod 4 (Spring) Expand Course Credit Hours *Business in the World Economy 2 *Elective 2 Elective 2 Elective 2 *Required Course YEAR TWO During your second year, you will be required to take Ethics in Business (offered at various times throughout the year) while customizing your

Finance 2 *Leading Teams and Organizations 2 *Management Communication 1 *Managerial Statistics 2 *Required Course Mod 2 (Fall) Expand Course Credit Hours *Managerial Economics 2 *Marketing Management 2 *Operations Management 2 *Required Course Mod 3 (Spring) Expand Course Credit Hours *Strategic Management 2 *Introduction to Managerial Accounting 2 Elective 2 Elective 2 *Required Course Mod 4 (Spring) Expand Course Credit Hours *Business in the World Economy 2 *Elective 2 Elective 2 Elective 2 *Required Course YEAR TWO During your second year, you will be required to take Ethics in Business (offered at various times throughout the year) while customizing your electives to your desired career goals. Modular System The Vanderbilt MBA academic calendar is based on a modular system of intensive courses, each seven weeks in length plus an exam week. Two "mods" equal one semester. Mods give you a fast start by allowing you to take courses in your chosen specialty as early as Mod 2 of your first year. You can complete significant study in your field of interest before taking on a summer internship. The total number of courses over a two-year period allows you the freedom and flexibility to take electives within your chosen specialty or branch out by taking courses in cross-functional areas of interest within Vanderbilt Owen Graduate School of Management or other schools at Vanderbilt. Year One As a candidate for a Vanderbilt MBA, you will study on campus for two years for a minimum of 62 credit hours. During your first year, you will receive an intense and immediate immersion in the fundamentals of management through 11 required core courses. The majority of core courses are taken during the first two mods. Year Two During your second year, you will take a required ethics class while customizing your electives to your desired career goals. Each student will complete at least one Concentration, which consists of 12 credit hours in a single discipline beyond the Core. Students are then free to take a wide variety of elective courses that best match their career aspirations. Further Customize Your Curriculum Students interested in a "deeper dive" into a discipline may choose to pursue a Specialization of 20 credit hours. Emphases allow students to augment their course of study with 8 credit hours in one of three areas. *Degree requirements and course information are subject to change; not all courses are offered every year. V iew

V iew the most recent Course Catalog containing academic policies, degree requirements and individual course descriptions for each of our degree programs. You’ll choose at least one concentration as your focus of study and may further customize your program by adding additional concentrations, specializations, or emphases. Concentrations Specializations Emphases Dual Degrees Previous Next Concentrations A concentration represents a minimum of 12 credit hours beyond the Core in a single discipline that is usually the foundation for your chosen career. Click on a concentration below to view details or discover more about all MBA concentrations here . ACCOUNTING FINANCE GENERAL MANAGEMENT HEALTHCARE HUMAN & ORGANIZATIONAL PERFORMANCE (HOP) MARKETING OPERATIONS & ANALYTICS STRATEGY Specializations Specializations are focused course tracks for students desiring an in-depth study of the functional area for their chosen career. Specializations require 20 credit hours of coursework beyond the Core. The 20-credit-hour requirement represents the 12 credit hours earned in the related concentration plus an additional eight hours. Click on a specialization below to view details or discover more about all MBA specializations here . BRAND MANAGEMENT CORPORATE FINANCE INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT Emphases An emphasis allows you to delve deeper into a particular industry or area of interest with eight hours of courses. Click on an emphasis below to view course requirements or see more details about all MBA emphases here . ENTREPRENEURSHIP INTERNATIONAL STUDIES SUSTAINABILITY & SOCIAL IMPACT Dual Degrees There is a significant benefit of time savings in pursuing an MBA as a joint degree. The traditional MBA program requires 62 hours (four full semesters) of course work. However, when pursued as part of a joint degree, the requirement is reduced to 50 credit hours (three semesters), since we will accept 12 hours from the partner school as electives. For the most current information about dual degrees including our partnerships

courses. Click on an emphasis below to view course requirements or see more details about all MBA emphases here . ENTREPRENEURSHIP INTERNATIONAL STUDIES SUSTAINABILITY & SOCIAL IMPACT Dual Degrees There is a significant benefit of time savings in pursuing an MBA as a joint degree. The traditional MBA program requires 62 hours (four full semesters) of course work. However, when pursued as part of a joint degree, the requirement is reduced to 50 credit hours (three semesters), since we will accept 12 hours from the partner school as electives. For the most current information about dual degrees including our partnerships with Meharry Medical College and Fisk University, click here . For questions or additional information our about dual degrees programs, please contact Gabriela Luis . CONNECT WITH A STUDENT IN YOUR AREA OF INTEREST CONNECT WITH A CURRENT STUDENT At Vanderbilt, learning is an active experience. You will have access to a wide array of hands-on activities, including industry-focused immersion experiences, conferences, career treks, case competitions, entrepreneurial opportunities, and more. LEARN MORE Watch Video Hear about Joshua Eniola's (MBA'21) independent study course. At Vanderbilt Business, you can work with your professors to create independent study courses designed to meet your unique academic and professional goals. Meet Our Faculty Vanderbilt students can choose from a wide range of internationally focused electives. In addition, students have the opportunity to participate in international seminar and research trips or may choose to study overseas through exchange programs with schools throughout the world. STUDY ABROAD INTERNATIONAL STUDIES EMPHASES CENTER FOR SOCIAL VENTURES OPPORTUNITIES OUTGOING EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FOR VANDERBILT BUSINESS STUDENTS INCOMING EXCHANGE PROGRAMS FOR INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS International students interested in studying at Vanderbilt Business are able to work in the U.S. for three years after graduation, thanks to the STEM designation awarded to the Vanderbilt MBA degree . The STEM designation allows international students to extend their post-completion Optional Practical Training (OPT) in the U.S. by 24 months, for a total of 36 months. Get Started Today MBA INCOMING EXCHANGE Exchange students may attend either fall or spring semesters, though most students arrive in the fall. Please note that orientation is required and our fall orientation occurs earlier than many of our partner schools. Semesters at Vanderbilt Owen Graduate School of Management are made up of two seven-week periods, called mods. Exchange students are required to have at least 6 total courses and may enroll in up to 8 courses for the semester, depending on their university’s requirements. Each seven-week course meets two times a week for 1.5 hours per class. The methodology of these courses varies according to the content and style of the lecturers, but they include case studies, group work and presentations, all with a high level of participation. Application Information Expand To apply for exchange, students from a partner university should first be nominated by their exchange coordinator. If you are eligible to be nominated by your exchange coordinator, students will receive the application and instructions. Students will submit an official transcript showing courses and grades from the home university, a resume, a photo, immunization history, and a financial declaration showing proof of sufficient finances for the four-month period. Please note that exchange students are required to carry the Vanderbilt Student Health Insurance regardless of other coverage they may have. Visas Expand All exchange visitors will be required to have a J-1 Exchange Visitor Visa issued by the U.S. Embassy or Consulate in your country. You will be furnished with a letter showing to study on exchange for the semester you will be at Vanderbilt. Please note that an interview with the U.S. Embassy is required and require an appointment, please plan accordingly. All visa matters are handled by the International Student and Scholars Services at Vanderbilt University (ISSS) . For more information, please see the Vanderbilt ISSS website or visit

Health Insurance regardless of other coverage they may have. Visas Expand All exchange visitors will be required to have a J-1 Exchange Visitor Visa issued by the U.S. Embassy or Consulate in your country. You will be furnished with a letter showing to study on exchange for the semester you will be at Vanderbilt. Please note that an interview with the U.S. Embassy is required and require an appointment, please plan accordingly. All visa matters are handled by the International Student and Scholars Services at Vanderbilt University (ISSS) . For more information, please see the Vanderbilt ISSS website or visit the website of the U.S. Embassy in your country. Accommodations Expand Vanderbilt does not have graduate student housing. Students are encouraged to begin their housing search as soon as possible. There is no on-campus housing available for graduate students other than married students with families, but there are several apartments nearby where students live. The Vanderbilt Owen Graduate School of Management exchange coordinator will provide a list of available apartments for rent. Approximate Living Expenses Expand Housing: $850 to $1,500 per month Meals: $400 per month Student Health Insurance: $1,600 to $1,800 per semester (approximately) Activity & Recreation Fee: $225 per semester (required) Books & Supplies: $750 per semester Services Expand Exchange students will be provided with access to an email account, printers, and wifi during their studies at Vanderbilt. Students should arrive with their own working laptops. Visiting students will be issued a temporary email account and a university student ID card, which allows access to all libraries on campus. Students may also use their student ID to ride Nashville MTA Bus free of charge Students have access to the fully equipped Recreation & Wellness Center with their student ID. Camping equipment is also available for rent. The Student Health Center is open 6 days a week during the semester. Clubs & Community Activities Expand Exchange students are invited and encouraged to join the varied Vanderbilt Business clubs and the weekly social events as well as other University community activities. We hope you will get involved in student life at Vanderbilt . Amazing Nashville Vanderbilt’s home, Nashville, is a great place to live and study. It’s a growing city and attracts people who love all kinds of music, food and a welcoming community. Vanderbilt’s home, Nashville, is a great place to live and study. It’s a growing city and
